page.title: 05Shopping in Yelden
page.content: Although there are no shops in Yelden several mobile grocers do call. A butcher from Kimbolton also calls and milk is delivered in Yelden on Mondays, Wednesdays and SAturdays by the Co-op dairy from Rushden at 23p per pint. Orders can be taken for eggs, bread and fruit juices. People in the village often use the Court Estate Post Office and General Store on the Newton Road in Rushden. The nearest town for shopping to Yelden, is Rushden. A temporary Post Office is set up in Yelden in the Village Hall on Thursday afternoons, which comes from Upper Dean. A Fish and Chip vn from Stanwick calls every Friday evening.
